original_solution_mapping.L1: Each of her aunts and uncles have a family unit of 1 son + 1 daughter + 1 aunt/uncle = <<1+1+1=3>>3 people.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Iris has a total of 3 uncles + 4 aunts = <<3+4=7>>7 aunts or uncles in these family units.
original_solution_mapping.L3: So among her aunts, uncles, and cousins, there will be 7 family units * 3 people in each family unit = <<7*3=21>>21 people.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Including her mother and brother, there will be a total of 21 people + 1 mother + 1 brother = <<21+1+1=23>>23 people coming to her party.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6775.
    Returns: the total number of people coming to Iris' birthday party.
    """
    # L1
    num_son_per_unit = 1 # a son
    num_daughter_per_unit = 1 # a daughter
    num_aunt_uncle_per_unit = 1 # 1 aunt/uncle
    people_per_family_unit = num_son_per_unit + num_daughter_per_unit + num_aunt_uncle_per_unit

    # L2
    num_uncles = 3 # 3 uncles
    num_aunts = 4 # 4 aunts
    total_aunts_uncles = num_uncles + num_aunts

    # L3
    people_from_family_units = total_aunts_uncles * people_per_family_unit

    # L4
    num_mother = 1 # her mother
    num_brother = 1 # her brother
    total_people = people_from_family_units + num_mother + num_brother

    # FA
    answer = total_people
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Each of her aunts and uncles have a family unit of {num_son_per_unit} son + {num_daughter_per_unit} daughter + {num_aunt_uncle_per_unit} aunt/uncle = <<{num_son_per_unit}+{num_daughter_per_unit}+{num_aunt_uncle_per_unit}={people_per_family_unit}>>{people_per_family_unit} people.
Iris has a total of {num_uncles} uncles + {num_aunts} aunts = <<{num_uncles}+{num_aunts}={total_aunts_uncles}>>{total_aunts_uncles} aunts or uncles in these family units.

So among her aunts, uncles, and cousins, there will be {total_aunts_uncles} family units * {people_per_family_unit} people in each family unit = <<{total_aunts_uncles}*{people_per_family_unit}={people_from_family_units}>>{people_from_family_units} people.

Including her mother and brother, there will be a total of {people_from_family_units} people + {num_mother} mother + {num_brother} brother = <<{people_from_family_units}+{num_mother}+{num_brother}={total_people}>>{total_people} people coming to her party.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Each of her aunts and uncles have a family unit of 1 son + 1 daughter + 1 aunt/uncle = <<1+1+1=3>>3 people.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Iris has a total of 3 uncles + 4 aunts = <<3+4=7>>7 aunts or uncles in these family units.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So among her aunts, uncles, and cousins, there will be 7 family units * 3 people in each family unit = <<7*3=21>>21 people.
